transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Hi, this is Brian calling about your overdue account. Is this Patricia?

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: Yes, but I already told your company I'm disputing this charge.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: I don't see any dispute in our system. Regardless, you still owe $2,400 and we need to resolve this soon.

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: I sent the dispute letter two weeks ago!

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Well, until it's processed, the debt is still valid. Can you make a payment today to show good faith?

transcript.speaker: client
transcript.text: I'm not paying anything until this is resolved properly.

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Look, I understand you're frustrated, but delaying payment could hurt your credit score. Let me see if I can find your dispute in the system. Can you hold for a moment?

transcript.speaker: agent
transcript.text: Thank you for holding. I do see a dispute was received. I'm going to escalate this to our dispute resolution team. They'll contact you within 3-5 business days. In the meantime, no collection activity will occur on your account.
